dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1662 IH: Emergency Liquidity Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Torres of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To direct the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to establish and maintain a permanent emergency lending program to provide member banks and other depository institutions with short-term liquidity against long-term assets.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Emergency Liquidity Act of 2023.

section.header: Federal Reserve System Permanent Emergency Lending Program
section.text: The Federal Reserve Act (12 U.S.C. 221 et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 10B the following:

The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall establish and maintain a permanent emergency lending program under which a Federal reserve bank may provide short-term liquidity to member banks or other depository institutions pledging any collateral eligible for purchase by the Federal reserve banks in open market operations.
